newsitem.title: USA: U.S. July business inventories rose 0.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: U.S. July business inventories rose 0.4 pct.

text.p: The Commerce Department said U.S. July business inventories rose 0.4 percent after being revised to unchanged in June. It said July business sales rose 1.2 percent after falling 0.5 percent in June.
The following lists business inventories and sales by sector, in billions of dollars, seasonally adjusted:

The department said July's inventory-to-sales ratio of 1.39 months' worth was the lowest since May, when it was also 1.39 months. The inventory-to-sales ratio is a measure of how long it would take to sell existing stocks at the current pace.
It said July business inventories posted the highest monthly rise since April, when they were also up 0.4 percent.
Wall Street economists had expected July business inventories to rise 0.2 percent.
Total auto inventories rose 1.4 percent in July, the biggest increase since a 2.0 percent rise in March 1995, the department said.
The department revised June business inventories from a previously reported 0.1 percent rise.
